# A tibble: 37 x 3 ## # Groups: year, month(date) [37] ## year `month(date)` n ## <dbl> <dbl> <int> ## 1 2016 12 2 ## 2 2017 1 1 ## 3 2017 2 56 ## 4 2017 3 26 ## 5 2017 5 6 ## 6 2017 6 64 ## 7 2017 7 12 ## 8 2017 8 29 ## 9 2017 9 32 ## 10 2017 11 4 ## # ... with 27 more rows android %>% count(date) %>% ggplot() + geom_line(aes(date,n)) + scale_x_date(breaks = "month", guide = guide_axis(n.dodge = 3)) 1.3.5 ãƒ‡ãƒ¼ã‚¿ã®æº–å‚™ 2019å¹´ã¨2020å¹´ã®ãƒ‡ãƒ¼ã‚¿ã®ã¿ã‚’ä½¿ã†ã“ã¨ã«ã™ã‚‹ã€‚ android_latest <- android %>% filter(year %in% c(2019, 2020)) ã‚¢ãƒ—ãƒªã®åå‰ãŒé•·ã„ã‹ã‚‰20æ–‡å­—ã¾ã§ã«ã™ã‚‹ã€‚ android_latest <- android_latest %>% mutate(header = if_else(str_length(header) >= 20, substr(header, 1, 20), header)) android <- android %>% mutate(header = if_else(str_length(header) >= 20, substr(header, 1, 20), header)) 1.3.6 ã‚¢ãƒ—ãƒªã®ä½¿ç”¨å›æ•°ï¼ˆ2019-2020ï¼‰ android_latest %>% count(header, sort = TRUE) %>% head(5) %>% mutate(header = fct_reorder(header, n)) %>% ggplot() + geom_col(aes(y = header, x = n)) + theme_minimal() + labs(title = "Most used Apps - Overall", subtitle = "Android Smartphone usage", caption = "Data:Google Takeout") 1.3.7 ã‚¢ãƒ—ãƒªã®ä½¿ç”¨å›æ•°ï¼ˆã™ã¹ã¦ã®å¹´ï¼‰ android %>% count(header, sort = TRUE) %>% head(5) %>% mutate(header = fct_reorder(header, n)) %>% ggplot() + geom_col(aes(y = header, x = n)) + theme_minimal() + labs(title = "Most used Apps - Overall", subtitle = "Android Smartphone usage", caption = "Data:Google Takeout") 1.3.8 æ¯”è¼ƒï¼ˆ2019 vs 2020ï¼‰ android_latest %>% filter(year %in% '2019') %>% group_by(year, header) %>% summarise(n = n()) %>% arrange(desc(n)) %>% head(5) %>% #View() mutate(header = fct_reorder(header, n)) %>% ggplot() + geom_col(aes(y = header, x = n)) + # facet_wrap(~year, scales = "free") + theme_minimal() + labs(title = "Most used Apps - 2019", subtitle = "Android Smartphone usage", caption = "Data:Google Takeout") -> p2019 ## `summarise()` regrouping output by 'year' (override with `.groups` argument) android_latest %>% filter(year %in% '2020') %>% group_by(year, header) %>% summarise(n = n()) %>% arrange(desc(n)) %>% head(5) %>% #View() mutate(header = fct_reorder(header, n)) %>% ggplot() + geom_col(aes(y = header, x = n)) + # facet_wrap(~year, scales = "free") + theme_minimal() + labs(title = "Most used Apps - 2020", subtitle = "Android Smartphone usage", caption = "Data:Google Takeout") -> p2020 ## `summarise()` regrouping output by 'year' (override with `.groups` argument) p2019 / p2020

2 2 34.7 135. ã€’112-0004 æ±äº¬éƒ½æ–‡äº¬åŒºå¾Œæ¥½~ å•†åº—è¡—A ç¦å³¶è–å¤©é€šå•†åº—è¡—~ ç¦å³¶è–å¤©é€šå•†åº—è¡—<br/>å•†åº—è¡—A<br/>ã€’112-00~ ## 3 3 35.2 137. ã€’112-0004 æ±äº¬éƒ½æ–‡äº¬åŒºå¾Œæ¥½~ å•†åº—è¡—B éŠ€åº§é€šã‚Šå•†åº—è¡—~ éŠ€åº§é€šã‚Šå•†åº—è¡—<br/>å•†åº—è¡—B<br/>ã€’112-000~ 3.4 ãƒãƒ¼ã‚«ãƒ¼ãƒªã‚¹ãƒˆ icon_df <- tibble(group = df$group, icon = paste0(here("picture/icon/"), "/",dir(here("picture/icon/"))[1:3])) icon_df ##
